cachedData.explanation: Incoming requests are first checked with the client's If Modified Since header to see if the client's cached version (if present) is the most recent, if so a 304 Not Modified is returned to the client instead of the requested data.  Otherwise the relevant cache is checked and if found used unless it needs refreshing.  If still no success, TightBlog will regenerate the item, send it to the client and cache it for subsequent use.  Note media objects aren't cached but their 304 stats are still collected.
cachedData.subtitle: Monitor/Refresh cached data
cachedData.promptReset: Reset daily hit count for all weblogs (usually handled by default scheduled task)
cachedData.promptIndex: Rebuild the index for a specific weblog (not normally necessary, indexes are maintained and kept current by default)
cachedData.indexingStarted: Successfully scheduled search index rebuild for weblog {handle}
cachedData.hitCountReset: Successfully reset all weblog hit counts to zero in the database.  Clear the Weblog Page cache if desired to immediately update the pages.

globalConfig.subtitle: Set site-wide configuration settings.
globalConfig.prompt: The settings here apply for all weblogs and can be adjusted at any time, taking effect immediately. Good to review these settings prior to creating your first blog, which can be done by selecting My Blogs from the top menu bar.  See each blog's Weblog Settings tab for blog-specific configuration.  Additional global configuration is available from your instance's application-tbcustom.properties file, however those changes require an application restart to take effect.
globalConfig.frontpageWeblogHandle: Weblog to serve as frontpage blog
globalConfig.newUsersCreateBlogs: New users may create weblogs by default?
globalConfig.allowAnalyticsCodeOverride: Allow individual blogs to override above code?
globalConfig.spamPolicy: What to do with comments identified as spam?

registration.approvalRequired: Register, verify email, and admin approval

htmlsanitizer.limited: Limited (bold, italic, underline and line/paragraph breaks)
htmlsanitizer.basic: Basic (Clickable links and line formatting -- pre, code, cite, etc.)
htmlsanitizer.relaxediframes: Relaxed plus iframes (Social media widgets, videos, scripting potential)
htmlsanitizer.off: Sanitizing turned off (Allows scripts, forms, everything.)

commentmod.nonAuthMustModerate: Yes, moderate all comments except from logged in users.
commentmod.nonPubMustModerate: Yes, moderate all comments except from blog's publishers.

spam.skipCheck: Skip spam check (all comments handled the same)
spam.markAsSpam: Mark as spam on comment review page
spam.noEmailNotification: Mark as spam and send no moderation emails
spam.autoDelete: Automatically delete with no notifications sent

tip.frontpageWeblogHandle: The default weblog shown at the application's base URL.  Will automatically be set to the first weblog created but can be later changed here.
tip.requiredRegistrationProcess: For best security, disable when everyone you want to have an account has one.
tip.newUsersCreateBlogs: Whether new users may create their own blogs or will instead rely on others creating blogs and assigning them to users via the blog's Members tab.  Can be overridden per account on the User Admin tab.
tip.htmlWhitelistLevel: Limit blog entries to only certain HTML tags to help prevent bloggers from doing anything bad to their readers with forms, JavaScript, etc.  Any disallowed elements will be stripped out from the text.  Largely unnecessary if you limit blogging accounts to people you fully trust (as you should).  Note: Affects only blog entry text, if restricting here you will probably also wish to disallow theme template customization for fuller protection.
tip.allowCustomTheme: Whether bloggers may switch their themes and/or customize their theme templates.
tip.maxMediaFileAllocationMb: Upload space allowed for media files (images, MP3s, etc.)  The application property file offers additional options for specifying allowable media file types as well as hiding the media file tab to disallow all uploads.
tip.defaultAnalyticsTrackingCode: Google Analytics or similar traffic determining code placed in the HTML header of all blogs.
tip.allowAnalyticsCodeOverride: If checked, allows an individual blogger to use his own tracking code in place of any code specified above.
tip.commentHtmlWhitelistLevel: HTML tags used by commenters outside the specified approved list will be stripped out.
tip.spamPolicy: TightBlog includes a configurable spam-checker for incoming comments.  When a comment is evaluated to be spam, how should it to be handled differently from a non-spam comment?  Option chosen here will mark the most permissive handling of spam (individual blogs may configure a more stringent handling.)
tip.emailComments: For non-moderated comments, sends an email to the weblog's members whenever a new comment is added. Also provides blog commenters a checkbox option to receive emails when subsequent comments occur for the entry.
tip.ignoreUrls: Comma-separated list of words to mark comments on any blog as spam. Commentor name, email, URL, and comment text are searched.  List provided here will be combined with any defined at the individual blog level for checking that blog's comments for spam.

tip.username: A short one-word username for logging into your account. Limited to simple alphanumeric characters (a-z and 0-9). Cannot be changed once account is created.
tip.password: Between 8 and 20 characters, with at least one uppercase, one lowercase, one number and one special character.

userAdmin.subtitle: Select user to edit

tip.password: User's password.  Fill in only if you are changing it.  Between 8 and 20 characters, with at least one uppercase, one lowercase, one number and one special character (any of @#$%^&+=).
tip.passwordConfirm: Re-type password, again only if changing.
tip.globalRole: Lone difference between BLOGGER and BLOGCREATOR is that the latter can create new blogs. ADMIN provides full TightBlog control (the rights you have).
tip.mfaSecret: The Multifactor Authentication (MFA) secret is used with a smartphone authenticator app.  If true, can be erased if the user wishes to re-register with the authenticator app upon next login (has a new smartphone, for example).
tip.userStatus: Only enabled users are able to log in.

tip.password: Account password, leave blank if not changing.

tip.screenname: Your desired screen name (with no HTML). This is what will be displayed in your weblog and on weblog entries that you write.

weblogConfig.deleteInstruction: To delete weblog, type in its handle ({handle}):
weblogConfig.createWeblogPrompt: Use this form to create a new weblog.  Starred fields are required.  Most fields can be provided/changed after the blog is created.  Avoid HTML in fields unless otherwise specified.
weblogConfig.updateWeblogPrompt: Manage settings for weblog {handle} (* = required field)
weblogConfig.deleteWarning: WARNING: Deleting a weblog will erase everything about the weblog: all of its entries, comments, templates and settings. Weblog removal is NOT REVERSIBLE.
weblogConfig.spamPolicy: What to do with comments identified as spam?
weblogConfig.entriesPerPage: Maximum entries to display on single weblog page
weblogConfig.defaultCommentDays: Default time to allow comments for new entries
weblogConfig.applyCommentDefaults: Apply above time limit to existing entries (this time only)?

tip.tagline: A subtitle that is used in some blog themes.
tip.handle: The handle forms part of the blog's URL needed to access your weblog. Limited to simple lowercase ASCII alphanumeric characters (a-z and 0-9).  Cannot be changed later.
tip.about: A blog summary used by some themes and blog directories.
tip.theme: The theme to be used to display this weblog. Later, if enabled by the blog administrator you can easily switch to another theme or customize your theme's templates.
tip.editFormat: Choose the default input format for new blog entries. Can be changed on a per-entry basis.
tip.visible: If unchecked, weblog will not be retrievable from a URL.
tip.locale: The default locale to be used for the display of this weblog when the browser does not specify a locale.
tip.timezone: The timezone to be used for weblog entry and time display.
tip.analyticsTrackingCode: Google Analytics or similar traffic determining code to be placed in your blog's header.
tip.ignoreUrls: Comma-separated list of words to mark comments on your blog as spam. Will be combined with any list configured at the global level by the system administrator. The commentor's name, email, URL, and comment text will be checked.
tip.spamPolicy: TightBlog includes a spam-checker for incoming comments.  When a comment is believed to be spam, choose how you would like it to be handled differently from a non-spam comment.
